poem:
**Power Outage**

In the hush  
of morning, lights falter—  
a continent sighs  
through electric veins.  
  
No shadows of  
intruding hands—  
just the quiet dance  
of wires resting,  
a temporary stillness,  
  
and somewhere,  
candles flicker  
in the heart's  
hidden corners.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Questions begin as Spain and Portugal recover from largest power cut in recent European history – Europe live 10.57am BST No evidence to suggest intrusion into operator's control system Speaking on Tuesday morning, the operator’s head of services, Eduardo Prieto, said that preliminary investigations meant “we can rule out a cybersecurity incident”. Prieto added that there was nothing to suggest “there was any kind of intrusion into the Red Eléctric control system”. 10.51am BST Power". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Questions begin as Spain and Portugal recover from largest power cut in recent European history – Europe live 10.57am BST No evidence to suggest intrusion into operator's control system Speaking on Tuesday morning, the operator’s head of services, Eduardo Prieto, said that preliminary investigations meant “we can rule out a cybersecurity incident”. Prieto added that there was nothing to suggest “there was any kind of intrusion into the Red Eléctric control system”. 10.51am BST Power
